ure the program throws

>

're doing is checking the /type/ of
the

ass matter? Do you have an example of

Code like:

try {
     // ...
} catch (IllegalA=
rgumentException e) {
     System.out.println ("1");
} catch (Exception e) =
{
     System.out.println ("2");
}

Will change output if you change from t=
hrowing an Exception to an
IllegalArgumentException. In JUnit we have asser=
tEquals, not
assertKindaLike. Assertions should be *exact* specifications o=
f
behavior.
